item.title: Stanley Druckenmiller says 'animal spirits' are back in markets because of Trump with CEOs 'giddy'
item.description: "I'd say CEOs are somewhere between relieved and giddy. So we're a believer in animal spirits," Druckenmiller said.

item.title: How stocks, gold and bitcoin fared in the first 100 days of Trump’s last presidency – and where they could go from here
item.description: Three investors shared their beliefs on whether certain asset classes could mirror their performances from Trump's first 100 days in office last time ...

item.title: Here are the top 10 U.S. stock analysts, according to TipRanks
item.description: TipRanks' analyst ranking service reveals the top 10 U.S. analysts whose ratings were the most successful between October 2023 to September 2024.

item.title: Citigroup picks high-yield stocks to play China as tariffs loom on the horizon
item.description: Citi analysts say some of their top picks are high-yielding China stocks as mainland markets prepare for tariffs and hope for government stimulus.

item.title: Berkshire Hathaway hasn't paid a dividend in nearly 60 years — Could that ever change?
item.description: Howard Buffett, Berkshire's future nonexecutive chairman, hesitated when asked about dividends when his father Warren is no long at the helm.
